intro: Scabiosa transylvanica, commonly known as the Transylvanian scabious, is a flowering plant native to the Carpathian region. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or woodland habitats and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps, which release tiny seeds when mature. Scabiosa transylvanica is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and wildflower meadows.
